subject: Economics
title: Surge Pricing: The Algorithm That Reads Your Desperation
description: A micro-lesson that makes Surge Pricing: The Algorithm That Reads Your Desperation usable.

hook.text: It's raining at 2 AM after a concert. Your Uber is 4.7x surge pricing.

buildup.text: Surge pricing adjusts prices in real time based on supply (available drivers) and demand (people requesting rides).

discovery.text: Economically, surge pricing works: higher prices attract more drivers and discourage non-urgent riders.

twist.text: Uber's algorithm surged prices during emergencies â€” hurricanes, terrorist attacks.

climax.text: Surge pricing is efficient but feels unfair.

punchline.text: The most efficient price is often the one that makes people angriest.

quiz.question: Why does surge pricing cause public backlash despite being economically efficient?
options: It feels exploitative because it charges more precisely when people are most desperate and vulnerable
